meanings.definition: relating to the study of pollen and spores
meanings.sent1: The palynological research focused on analyzing different types of pollen under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use palynological techniques to understand the pollen distribution in various ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The palynological investigation into the flower's pollen revealed some surprising patterns.
meanings.sent4: Her palynological expertise allowed her to uncover hidden secrets within the pollen samples.
meanings.sent5: The palynological study painted a vivid picture of the intricate world of pollen and spores.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the analysis of pollen samples
meanings.sent1: The palynological examination of the pollen samples revealed valuable information about plant reproduction.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on palynological methods to identify different pollen grains accurately.
meanings.sent3: The palynological study of the pollen samples turned into a fascinating puzzle for the scientists.
meanings.sent4: His palynological skills were crucial in deciphering the origin of the pollen found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The palynological analysis provided a clear picture of the pollen composition in the area.

meanings.definition: involving the examination of plant reproductive structures
meanings.sent1: The palynological investigation focused on studying the reproductive structures of various plants.
meanings.sent2: Palynological studies help in understanding the diversity of plant reproductive systems.
meanings.sent3: The palynological exploration of the plant's reproductive structures led to some interesting discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The palynological examination revealed the intricate details of the plant's reproductive mechanisms.
meanings.sent5: Her palynological observations shed light on the complex nature of plant reproductive structures.
